                 <div class="txtNew" data-min-height="247" data-packed="false" id="comp-ivdy466e" style="top:146px;bottom:;left:20px;right:;width:258px;height:auto;position:absolute;min-height:247px;margin-left:calc((100% - 980px) * 0.5)">
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:center;">
                   <span style="font-size:18px;">
                    <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                     <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      Stewart Hosie is the Member of Parliament for Dundee East and serves as the SNP Spokesperson for International Trade at Westminster.
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                  </h1>
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:center;">
                  </h1>
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:center;">
                   <span style="font-size:18px;">
                    <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                     <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                      Stewart first
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                   <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                    <span style="font-size:18px;">
                     <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                      won his seat in 2005, held it in 2010,  again in 2015 and was most recently re-elected in 2017 with the highest majority of any SNP MP.
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                   <span style="font-size:18px;">
                    <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">

 .txtNew ul ul ul,.txtNew ol ul ul {list-style-type:square;}

 .txtNew ul[dir="rtl"],.txtNew ol[dir="rtl"] {padding-left:0;padding-right:1.3em;margin-left:0;margin-right:0.5em;}
 .txtNew ul[dir="rtl"] ul,.txtNew ul[dir="rtl"] ol,.txtNew ol[dir="rtl"] ul,.txtNew ol[dir="rtl"] ol {padding-left:0;padding-right:1.3em;margin-left:0;margin-right:0.5em;}
 .txtNew p {margin:0;line-height:normal;letter-spacing:normal;}
 .txtNew h1 {margin:0;line-height:normal;letter-spacing:normal;}
 .txtNew h2 {margin:0;line-height:normal;letter-spacing:normal;}
 .txtNew h3 {margin:0;line-height:normal;letter-spacing:normal;}
 .txtNew h4 {margin:0;line-height:normal;letter-spacing:normal;}

 .txtNew a {color:inherit;}
                 </style>
                 <div class="txtNew" data-hidden="true" data-min-height="593" data-packed="false" id="comp-ive0y5zj" style="top:132px;bottom:;left:38px;right:;width:287px;height:auto;position:absolute;min-height:593px;margin-left:calc((100% - 980px) * 0.5);visibility:hidden">
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:justify;">
                   <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                    <span style="font-size:18px;">
                     <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                      Stewart was born in Dundee in 1963. He was educated at Brackens PS, Invertay PS Monifieth, Carnoustie High School, and Bell Street Tech (now Abertay University) where he gained an HD in Computer Studies.
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                  </h1>
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:justify;">
                  </h1>
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:justify;">
                   <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                    <span style="font-size:18px;">
                     <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                      Stewart is a highly experienced political campaigner, Stewart was the SNP's first Youth Convener and spent four years as the Party's National Secretary before being elected as the Organisation Convener in 2003.
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                  </h1>
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:justify;">
                   <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                    <span style="font-size:18px;">
                     <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                      <span class="wixGuard">
                       ​
                      </span>
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                  </h1>
                  <h1 class="font_0" style="font-size:18px; text-align:justify;">
                   <span style="color:rgb(0, 0, 0);">
                    <span style="font-size:18px;">
                     <span style="font-family:wfont_e540b0_342bd780062641949669ee3ebb2f1133,wf_342bd780062641949669ee3eb,orig_sensibility;">
                      Stewart contested the Dundee East Westminster seat in 2001 delivering a 5% swing to the SNP and slashing the Labour majority by 5,500 votes. He won the seat in 2005, held it in 2010, again in 2015 and was most recently re-elected in 2017 with the highest majority of any SNP MP.
                     </span>
                    </span>
                   </span>
                  </h1>
                 </div>

MPs URGE PUBLIC TO HELP DUNDEE FOODBANK","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-07-23T12:08:49.564Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie and Dundee West MP Chris Law have urged members of the public to help stock Dundee Foodbank following a recent shortage.<br>\n<br>\nDundee Foodbank has recently seen a sharp increase in the number of food parcels given out, largely due to the summer holidays, and has issued an appeal asking for more donations.<\/hatul><hatul >In particular the foodbank has requested more donations of:<\/hatul><hatul >- pasta sauces<\/hatul><hatul >- tinned fish (especially tuna)<\/hatul><hatul >- tinned fruit<\/hatul><hatul >- tinned puddings (especially custard and rice puddings)<\/hatul><hatul >- UHT milk (especially whole and semi-skimmed)<\/hatul><hatul >Over the years Dundee has seen a dramatic increase in the number of people turning to food banks for help, which can largely be attributed to the rollout of Universal Credit in the area.<\/hatul><hatul >Both Dundee MPs have appealed to the public to give generously and have promised use of their shared office at 8 Old Glamis Road in Dundee as a collection point for any donations to the foodbank.<\/hatul><hatul >As well as handing in donations to the foodbank and the Parliamentary Office on 8 Old Glamis Road people can donate at collection points at the following locations:<\/hatul><hatul >-Tesco Riverside<\/hatul><hatul >-Tesco South Road<\/hatul><hatul >-Asda Milton<\/hatul><hatul >-Asda Kirkton<\/hatul><hatul >-Sainsburys Dundee<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie said:<\/hatul><hatul >“This is extremely concerning, especially given that so many people rely on Dundee Foodbank for help.”<\/hatul><hatul >“It is scandalous that in this day and age so many people are forced into relying on foodbanks for their basic necessities. The UK Government should be ashamed of their policies which have driven so many into destitution and have created such a reliance on charities and third sector organisations such as Dundee Foodbank.”<\/hatul><hatul >“Dundee is a city known for its generosity therefore I hope people will continue to do what they can to help. No one should have to go to bed hungry or worry about where their next meal is going to come from or when they can next expect to eat.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I am happy to offer space in my office to collect donations for Dundee foodbank. Constituents can also discuss any ongoing problems with Universal Credit and other benefits with my team and I at any time throughout the week by emailing me or calling my office.”<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting Dundee West MP Chris Law said:<br>\n<br>\n“We have seen how changes to the benefits system such as Universal Credit have had an adverse effect especially on the lives and finances of claimants, and foodbank use is sadly on the rise not just in Dundee but across the country.”<\/hatul><hatul >“Dundee Foodbank do excellent work helping those in need, particularly during pressing times, but that work relies on the sustained support of members of the Dundee community.”<br>\n<br>\n“I am happy to help offer a space along with Stewart Hosie to collect goods for the foodbank. Constituents can also discuss any ongoing problems with Universal Credit and other benefits with my team 10am-4pm weekdays.”<\/hatul>","links":[],"version":3},"coverImageData":{"_type":"CoverImageData","coverImageType":"","video":{"_type":"wix:Video","videoId":"","videoType":"","thumbnail":""},"photo":{"_type":"wix:Image","title":"","src":"","width":1280,"height":960},"isHD":false,"isHeroImage":false},"description":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"","links":[],"version":1},"mobileTitle":"CITY MPs URGE PUBLIC TO HELP DUNDEE FOODBANK","_iid":"5b55c4fae6ac710b957e0ab4","_hash":"995bbb95443dcae7ba41b6f113738a16","_createdAt":"2018-07-23T12:07:22.082Z","_updatedAt":"2018-07-23T12:08:51.438Z","permalink":"2018\/07\/23\/CITY-MPs-URGE-PUBLIC-TO-HELP-DUNDEE-FOODBANK","permalinkVersion":"2","defaultPost":false,"author":"","categories":[]},"5b4489c7e6ac7146e19beec2":{"_type":"MediaPost","title":"Stewart Hosie MP backs &#39;Trauma Teddy&#39; scheme","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-07-10T11:20:53.203Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">LOCAL MP BACKS ‘TRAUMA TEDDIES’ SCHEME<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie has given his backing to a scheme started in Longhaugh Police Station in Scotland that sees police officers utilise knitted teddy bears to break down barriers with young children in potentially traumatic situations such as domestic violence call outs, road accidents and assaults.<\/hatul><hatul >Since starting the scheme earlier this year hundreds of teddy bears have been donated to Longhaugh Police Station. As well as helping to break down the communication barriers between Police Officers and young children the teddy bears – a symbol of comfort and safety in childhood - can also help prevent or reduce the possible long-term damage that an adverse childhood experience (ACE) can cause to young children.<\/hatul><hatul >Schemes such as this one are currently common practice in Australia and in parts of England and Wales however this is the first part of Scotland to adopt such a scheme. It is hoped that all Scottish Police divisions will soon follow suit – with a number currently looking to adopt it in the near future.<\/hatul><hatul >On a visit to Longhaugh Police Station Mr Hosie met with Inspector Chris Boath, PC Lynsay Jackson, PC Andy Kerr and Janie&nbsp;Mair – Service Manager of Children First Dundee and Tayside – to learn more about the scheme and ACE awareness as well as to discuss how he can help promote the trauma teddies. Stewart also donated a teddy to the station. &nbsp;<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >“The scheme is so simple but the impact it can have on young children is extraordinary.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I was thoroughly impressed, not just by the officers perseverance and dedication to this scheme but by the amazing response from the local community and organisations like Children First. Some of the teddies take a number of days to knit and the fact that they have received over 500 of them from local people is phenomenal. This is a prime example of the real sense of community spirit that is alive and well throughout my constituency.”<\/hatul><hatul >“On the visit I assured the officers that I will do everything that I can to assist in the rollout of this fantastic scheme in Dundee and across the country.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting Inspector Chris Boath said:&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >\"Longhaugh Community Team and Police Scotland would like to thank Mr Hosie for his support and taking the time to visit and learn more about the Trauma Teddy initiative. Mr Hosie was very supportive and recognised the value of the initiative - not only as a gesture but a genuine opportunity for Police Officers to engage with children across Scotland.\"<\/hatul><hatul welcomed news that the council will be considering installing a yellow box junction where Clepington Road meets Forfar Road in the city after he sought information from them on what possible measures could be introduced to alleviate congestion problems in the area.<\/hatul><hatul >The junction is incredibly busy, particularly during peak times of the day, something that will no doubt increase when the Dundee Transport Museum moves to the old Maryfield Tram Depot.<\/hatul><hatul >Following his request to Dundee city council they responded confirming that it will be looked into later in the summer.<\/hatul><hatul >Mr Hosie, who wrote to the council after receiving several enquiries from concerned constituents about the junction, expressed his desire to reduce any risk of future accidents and to keep the flow of traffic as intended.<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting Stewart Hosie MP said:<\/hatul><hatul >“The safety of Dundee citizens is absolutely paramount and I am glad that the Council Transport Museum to the old Maryfield Tram Depot site that the area is not only safe for the residents and visitors to the city but that the traffic flows as intended and congestion is kept to a disgust at the Conservatives and Labour for their failure to protect the Scottish Parliament and stop a blatant powergrab.<\/hatul><hatul >Last night the House of Commons voted on the EU Withdrawal bill, which would not only seek to take Britain out of the EU but would strip several powers from the Scottish Parliament and hand them over to Westminster.<\/hatul><hatul >An amendment, tabled by the SNP, sought to ensure that the powers would stay with the Scottish Parliament and that the devolution settlement was respected. In the 15 minutes allocated for the debate not a single Scottish MP was heard and the debate was filibustered by an English Conservative MP.<\/hatul><hatul >When Ian Blackford, SNP Group leader in Westminster, asked what options are open to MPs from Scotland for a proper debate on devolution and Brexit, Conservative MP Ian Liddell- Grainger shouted “Suicide” from the backbenches.<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting Stewart Hosie MP said:<\/hatul><hatul >“Last night only 15 minutes were allowed to debate the Tories powergrab. In that 15 minutes no Scottish MPs were called to speak and the \"debate\" was filibustered by an English Tory MP.”<\/hatul><hatul >“It just goes to show, once more, the conservatives utter contempt for the people of Scotland and our democratically elected parliament.”<\/hatul><hatul >“The vote was a real opportunity for the Labour party – who are usually so quick to claim credit for devolution – to prove to the people of Scotland that they are on their side and have the backbone to stand up to the Tories but as usual they sat on their hands and allowed the Conservatives to force through their undemocratic proposals.”<\/hatul><hatul >&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">ENDS<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">NOTES TO RELEASE - LOCAL MP WELCOMES FERRY BEACH AWARD","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-06-05T14:17:14.711Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie has welcomed the news that Broughty Ferry Beach has once again been given a Scottish Beach Award by ‘Keep Scotland Beautiful’ which recognised “The high standards provided to users”.<\/hatul><hatul >The announcement comes just days after the beach was also given an “excellent” rating for its water quality.<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting on the award Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie said:<\/hatul><hatul >“Broughty Ferry beach is one of the most beautiful parts of Tayside and one of its best beaches, I’m glad that this award recognises not only the beach itself but the hard work from the Council staff who work tirelessly to maintain its beauty.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I hope this award encourages people who are considering a visit to Dundee to travel here and witness our city’s many spectacular sights.”<\/hatul><hatul >“The council do a terrific job of cleaning and maintaining the beach but keeping our city tidy is a responsibility for everyone. I was disappointed to see last Monday the state that the beach was left in after the surge in visitors during the lovely bank holiday. If we want to continue to attract global investment and high levels of tourism we all need to chip in to help ensure Dundee continues to be an attractive place to live and visit.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">ENDS<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Notes to editors:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Media enquiries&nbsp;jack@dundeesnp.org&nbsp;01382 623200<\/span><\/hatul>","links":[],"version":3},"coverImageData":{"_type":"CoverImageData","coverImageType":"","video":{"_type":"wix:Video","videoId":"","videoType":"","thumbnail":""},"photo":{"_type":"wix:Image","title":"","src":"","width":1280,"height":960},"isHD":false,"isHeroImage":false},"description":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"","links":[],"version":1},"mobileTitle":"PRESS RELEASE - LOCAL MP WELCOMES FERRY BEACH AWARD","_iid":"5b169b2d9890cc1b8f011694","_hash":"f7d3a80ba49fc81ab33a026e9586967e","_createdAt":"2018-06-05T14:16:13.429Z","_updatedAt":"2018-06-05T14:17:16.387Z","permalink":"2018\/06\/05\/PRESS-RELEASE---LOCAL-MP-WELCOMES-FERRY-BEACH-AWARD","permalinkVersion":"2","defaultPost":false,"author":"","categories":[]},"5b0d1b789890cc1b8ff24e41":{"_type":"MediaPost","title":"MP WELCOMES INCREASE IN GLOBAL INTEREST IN DUNDEE","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-05-28T09:20:00.000Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie has welcomed the news that Dundee has been named in LonelyPlanet’s top 10 European destinations for 2018. Following the announcement tourism leaders in Dundee have predicted a huge boost for the city, with hotel managers saying that the phones have been “ringing off the hook”.<\/hatul><hatul >The news comes ahead of the opening of the V&amp;A, which will open in September and will add to the ever-growing list of vibrant and exciting cultural landmarks in Dundee and is expected to attract tens of thousands of visitors in the first months of its opening.<\/hatul><hatul >Mr Hosie met with VisitDundee Chairman, Paul Jennings, and Dundee City Development Convenor Lynne Short earlier this month to discuss the plans for the organisation and how they can work together to help boost the profile of Dundee around the globe.<\/hatul><hatul >Following his meeting with Mr Jennings, Mr Hosie wrote to Fiona Hyslop, Cabinet Secretary for Culture, Tourism and External Affairs, to ask what support can be given to organisations such as VisitDundee.<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting Stewart Hosie MP said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >“It seems like every day I am seeing new global endorsements for Dundee from the international media. Interest in our city has never been so high and there is a real buzz here because of it.”<\/hatul><hatul >“With the V&amp;A opening in September, The Open returning to Carnoustie in July and big stars playing at Slessor Gardens,&nbsp;there is a real sense of confidence in the City. It’s important that we capture this energy and use it&nbsp;to promote Dundee globally&nbsp;for years to come.”<\/hatul><hatul >“It’s important that we continue to heavily promote, not just the V&amp;A but all of the fantastic sights and attractions in Dundee and the surrounding area. People should know that&nbsp;this part of Scotland&nbsp;has a&nbsp;huge amount to offer.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I’m glad that this initiative (VisitDundee) has been set up and will seek to encourage&nbsp;visitors&nbsp;to spend&nbsp;time&nbsp;here so they can fully explore everything&nbsp;Dundee&nbsp;has to offer.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting on VisitDundee Dundee City Development Convenor and Maryfield Councillor Lynne Short said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >“All public-private partnerships are incredibly important to the city, it’s great to see that this organisation is now in existence. I’m looking forward to working with them in the future to bring more people to Dundee. The city’s regeneration has so far been fantastic however we must all work together to ensure it works for every part of Dundee, from the smallest bairn to the biggest company.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Paul Jennings of VisitDundee said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >\"VisitDundee has been created to help capture the incredible opportunity facing the city, we want to maximise the economic impact of our tourism assets for the benefit of the wider community. We hope to work across the private and public sector as promoting Dundee as a great place to visit and stay needs to be an inclusive effort.\"<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">ENDS<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Notes to editors<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >Media enquiries contact&nbsp;jack@dundeesnp.org&nbsp;01382 623200<\/hatul>","links":[],"version":3},"coverImageData":{"_type":"CoverImageData","coverImageType":"photo","video":{"_type":"wix:Video","videoId":"","videoType":"","thumbnail":""},"photo":{"_type":"wix:Image","title":"","src":"e540b0_7e47e2e0eff44f0f9c3658c6d5aebce4~mv2.jpg","width":720,"height":960},"isHD":false,"isHeroImage":false},"description":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"","links":[],"version":1},"mobileTitle":"MP WELCOMES INCREASE IN GLOBAL INTEREST IN DUNDEE","_iid":"5b0d1b789890cc1b8ff24e41","_hash":"9f764cb30843c047726068a1280df415","_createdAt":"2018-05-29T09:20:56.924Z","_updatedAt":"2018-05-29T09:24:48.667Z","permalink":"2018\/05\/28\/MP-WELCOMES-INCREASE-IN-GLOBAL-INTEREST-IN-DUNDEE","permalinkVersion":"2","defaultPost":false,"author":"","categories":[]},"5b0d42b6e6ac715ab4ffb4a9":{"_type":"MediaPost","title":"PDSA","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-05-15T12:08:00.000Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul>Last week I joined my SNP colleague&nbsp;Chris Law MP&nbsp;in visiting the PDSA hospital in Dundee.<\/hatul><hatul>The PDSA recently announced their introduction of a reduced cost service for those who are in receipt of numerous benefits, in addition to their existing free service for those on Housing Benefit, Universal Credit with Housing element or Council Tax Support.<\/hatul><hatul>Those who can benefit from the reduced cost service include those on Child Tax or Working Tax Credits, Universal Credit without&nbsp;housing elements, Pension Credit, Job Seeker’s Allowance, Income Support, ESA, Disability Living Allowance, Personal Independence Payments, or a combination of any number of these benefits. State-retired pensioners who are householders in Council Tax Bands A-D are also eligible for the reduced cost service.<\/hatul><hatul>I was thoroughly impressed, not just by the facilities but by the dedication and commitment of the staff there. It is quite obvious that the vets and nurses care deeply about the animals and their owners, I’m happy to see this scheme being rolled out which will help pets and their owners across the city even more.<\/hatul><hatul>The PDSA is a fantastic charity and one that is well worth our support, I would encourage everyone to try and support them in what way they can. Last year alone, the Dundee centre treated 4,000 pets in over 20,000 procedures.<\/hatul>","links":[],"version":3},"coverImageData":{"_type":"CoverImageData","coverImageType":"photo","video":{"_type":"wix:Video","videoId":"","videoType":"","thumbnail":""},"photo":{"_type":"wix:Image","title":"","src":"e540b0_61847287d9694dc8b1c4e8d53ade2e16~mv2.jpg","width":960,"height":720},"isHD":false,"isHeroImage":false},"description":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"","links":[],"version":1},"mobileTitle":"PDSA","_iid":"5b0d42b6e6ac715ab4ffb4a9","_hash":"548f4e24b2c2ebbfbdbe63e766ab6228","_createdAt":"2018-05-29T12:08:22.207Z","_updatedAt":"2018-05-29T12:20:41.217Z","permalink":"2018\/05\/15\/PDSA","permalinkVersion":"2","defaultPost":false,"author":"","categories":[]},"5b0d45f36f8a3e0cc708d652":{"_type":"MediaPost","title":"National Stroke Awareness Month","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-05-14T12:21:00.000Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul style=\"line-height: 1.5em;\" >Earlier this month I visited the Chest Heart and Stroke Scotland shop on Reform Street in Dundee. MPs URGE PUBLIC TO HELP DUNDEE FOODBANK","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-07-23T12:08:49.564Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie and Dundee West MP Chris Law have urged members of the public to help stock Dundee Foodbank following a recent shortage.<br>\n<br>\nDundee Foodbank has recently seen a sharp increase in the number of food parcels given out, largely due to the summer holidays, and has issued an appeal asking for more donations.<\/hatul><hatul >In particular the foodbank has requested more donations of:<\/hatul><hatul >- pasta sauces<\/hatul><hatul >- tinned fish (especially tuna)<\/hatul><hatul >- tinned fruit<\/hatul><hatul >- tinned puddings (especially custard and rice puddings)<\/hatul><hatul >- UHT milk (especially whole and semi-skimmed)<\/hatul><hatul >Over the years Dundee has seen a dramatic increase in the number of people turning to food banks for help, which can largely be attributed to the rollout of Universal Credit in the area.<\/hatul><hatul >Both Dundee MPs have appealed to the public to give generously and have promised use of their shared office at 8 Old Glamis Road in Dundee as a collection point for any donations to the foodbank.<\/hatul><hatul >As well as handing in donations to the foodbank and the Parliamentary Office on 8 Old Glamis Road people can donate at collection points at the following locations:<\/hatul><hatul >-Tesco Riverside<\/hatul><hatul >-Tesco South Road<\/hatul><hatul >-Asda Milton<\/hatul><hatul >-Asda Kirkton<\/hatul><hatul >-Sainsburys Dundee<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie said:<\/hatul><hatul >“This is extremely concerning, especially given that so many people rely on Dundee Foodbank for help.”<\/hatul><hatul >“It is scandalous that in this day and age so many people are forced into relying on foodbanks for their basic necessities. The UK Government should be ashamed of their policies which have driven so many into destitution and have created such a reliance on charities and third sector organisations such as Dundee Foodbank.”<\/hatul><hatul >“Dundee is a city known for its generosity therefore I hope people will continue to do what they can to help. No one should have to go to bed hungry or worry about where their next meal is going to come from or when they can next expect to eat.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I am happy to offer space in my office to collect donations for Dundee foodbank. Constituents can also discuss any ongoing problems with Universal Credit and other benefits with my team and I at any time throughout the week by emailing me or calling my office.”<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting Dundee West MP Chris Law said:<br>\n<br>\n“We have seen how changes to the benefits system such as Universal Credit have had an adverse effect especially on the lives and finances of claimants, and foodbank use is sadly on the rise not just in Dundee but across the country.”<\/hatul><hatul >“Dundee Foodbank do excellent work helping those in need, particularly during pressing times, but that work relies on the sustained support of members of the Dundee community.”<br>\n<br>\n“I am happy to help offer a space along with Stewart Hosie to collect goods for the foodbank. Constituents can also discuss any ongoing problems with Universal Credit and other benefits with my team 10am-4pm weekdays.”<\/hatul>","links":[],"version":3},"coverImageData":{"_type":"CoverImageData","coverImageType":"","video":{"_type":"wix:Video","videoId":"","videoType":"","thumbnail":""},"photo":{"_type":"wix:Image","title":"","src":"","width":1280,"height":960},"isHD":false,"isHeroImage":false},"description":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"","links":[],"version":1},"mobileTitle":"CITY MPs URGE PUBLIC TO HELP DUNDEE FOODBANK","_iid":"5b55c4fae6ac710b957e0ab4","_hash":"995bbb95443dcae7ba41b6f113738a16","_createdAt":"2018-07-23T12:07:22.082Z","_updatedAt":"2018-07-23T12:08:51.438Z","permalink":"2018\/07\/23\/CITY-MPs-URGE-PUBLIC-TO-HELP-DUNDEE-FOODBANK","permalinkVersion":"2","defaultPost":false,"author":"","categories":[],"httpsOnPublish":false},"5b4489c7e6ac7146e19beec2":{"_type":"PhotoPost","title":"Stewart Hosie MP backs &#39;Trauma Teddy&#39; scheme","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-07-10T11:20:53.203Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">LOCAL MP BACKS ‘TRAUMA TEDDIES’ SCHEME<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie has given his backing to a scheme started in Longhaugh Police Station in Scotland that sees police officers utilise knitted teddy bears to break down barriers with young children in potentially traumatic situations such as domestic violence call outs, road accidents and assaults.<\/hatul><hatul >Since starting the scheme earlier this year hundreds of teddy bears have been donated to Longhaugh Police Station. As well as helping to break down the communication barriers between Police Officers and young children the teddy bears – a symbol of comfort and safety in childhood - can also help prevent or reduce the possible long-term damage that an adverse childhood experience (ACE) can cause to young children.<\/hatul><hatul >Schemes such as this one are currently common practice in Australia and in parts of England and Wales however this is the first part of Scotland to adopt such a scheme. It is hoped that all Scottish Police divisions will soon follow suit – with a number currently looking to adopt it in the near future.<\/hatul><hatul >On a visit to Longhaugh Police Station Mr Hosie met with Inspector Chris Boath, PC Lynsay Jackson, PC Andy Kerr and Janie&nbsp;Mair – Service Manager of Children First Dundee and Tayside – to learn more about the scheme and ACE awareness as well as to discuss how he can help promote the trauma teddies. Stewart also donated a teddy to the station. &nbsp;<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >“The scheme is so simple but the impact it can have on young children is extraordinary.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I was thoroughly impressed, not just by the officers perseverance and dedication to this scheme but by the amazing response from the local community and organisations like Children First. Some of the teddies take a number of days to knit and the fact that they have received over 500 of them from local people is phenomenal. This is a prime example of the real sense of community spirit that is alive and well throughout my constituency.”<\/hatul><hatul >“On the visit I assured the officers that I will do everything that I can to assist in the rollout of this fantastic scheme in Dundee and across the country.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting Inspector Chris Boath said:&nbsp;&nbsp;<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >\"Longhaugh Community Team and Police Scotland would like to thank Mr Hosie for his support and taking the time to visit and learn more about the Trauma Teddy initiative. Mr Hosie was very supportive and recognised the value of the initiative - not only as a gesture but a genuine opportunity for Police Officers to engage with children across Scotland.\"<\/hatul><hatul news that Broughty Ferry Beach has once again been given a Scottish Beach Award by ‘Keep Scotland Beautiful’ which recognised “The high standards provided to users”.<\/hatul><hatul >The announcement comes just days after the beach was also given an “excellent” rating for its water quality.<\/hatul><hatul >Commenting on the award Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie said:<\/hatul><hatul >“Broughty Ferry beach is one of the most beautiful parts of Tayside and one of its best beaches, I’m glad that this award recognises not only the beach itself but the hard work from the Council staff who work tirelessly to maintain its beauty.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I hope this award encourages people who are considering a visit to Dundee to travel here and witness our city’s many spectacular sights.”<\/hatul><hatul >“The council do a terrific job of cleaning and maintaining the beach but keeping our city tidy is a responsibility for everyone. I was disappointed to see last Monday the state that the beach was left in after the surge in visitors during the lovely bank holiday. If we want to continue to attract global investment and high levels of tourism we all need to chip in to help ensure Dundee continues to be an attractive place to live and visit.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">ENDS<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Notes to editors:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Media enquiries&nbsp;jack@dundeesnp.org&nbsp;01382 623200<\/span><\/hatul>","links":[],"version":3},"coverImageData":{"_type":"CoverImageData","coverImageType":"","video":{"_type":"wix:Video","videoId":"","videoType":"","thumbnail":""},"photo":{"_type":"wix:Image","title":"","src":"","width":1280,"height":960},"isHD":false,"isHeroImage":false},"description":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"","links":[],"version":1},"mobileTitle":"PRESS RELEASE - LOCAL MP WELCOMES FERRY BEACH AWARD","_iid":"5b169b2d9890cc1b8f011694","_hash":"f7d3a80ba49fc81ab33a026e9586967e","_createdAt":"2018-06-05T14:16:13.429Z","_updatedAt":"2018-06-05T14:17:16.387Z","permalink":"2018\/06\/05\/PRESS-RELEASE---LOCAL-MP-WELCOMES-FERRY-BEACH-AWARD","permalinkVersion":"2","defaultPost":false,"author":"","categories":[],"httpsOnPublish":false},"5b0d1b789890cc1b8ff24e41":{"_type":"PhotoPost","title":"MP WELCOMES INCREASE IN GLOBAL INTEREST IN DUNDEE","date":{"_type":"wix:Date","iso":"2018-05-28T09:20:00.000Z"},"text":{"_type":"wix:RichText","text":"<hatul >Dundee East MP Stewart Hosie has welcomed the news that Dundee has been named in LonelyPlanet’s top 10 European destinations for 2018. Following the announcement tourism leaders in Dundee have predicted a huge boost for the city, with hotel managers saying that the phones have been “ringing off the hook”.<\/hatul><hatul >The news comes ahead of the opening of the V&amp;A, which will open in September and will add to the ever-growing list of vibrant and exciting cultural landmarks in Dundee and is expected to attract tens of thousands of visitors in the first months of its opening.<\/hatul><hatul >Mr Hosie met with VisitDundee Chairman, Paul Jennings, and Dundee City Development Convenor Lynne Short earlier this month to discuss the plans for the organisation and how they can work together to help boost the profile of Dundee around the globe.<\/hatul><hatul >Following his meeting with Mr Jennings, Mr Hosie wrote to Fiona Hyslop, Cabinet Secretary for Culture, Tourism and External Affairs, to ask what support can be given to organisations such as VisitDundee.<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting Stewart Hosie MP said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >“It seems like every day I am seeing new global endorsements for Dundee from the international media. Interest in our city has never been so high and there is a real buzz here because of it.”<\/hatul><hatul >“With the V&amp;A opening in September, The Open returning to Carnoustie in July and big stars playing at Slessor Gardens,&nbsp;there is a real sense of confidence in the City. It’s important that we capture this energy and use it&nbsp;to promote Dundee globally&nbsp;for years to come.”<\/hatul><hatul >“It’s important that we continue to heavily promote, not just the V&amp;A but all of the fantastic sights and attractions in Dundee and the surrounding area. People should know that&nbsp;this part of Scotland&nbsp;has a&nbsp;huge amount to offer.”<\/hatul><hatul >“I’m glad that this initiative (VisitDundee) has been set up and will seek to encourage&nbsp;visitors&nbsp;to spend&nbsp;time&nbsp;here so they can fully explore everything&nbsp;Dundee&nbsp;has to offer.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Commenting on VisitDundee Dundee City Development Convenor and Maryfield Councillor Lynne Short said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >“All public-private partnerships are incredibly important to the city, it’s great to see that this organisation is now in existence. I’m looking forward to working with them in the future to bring more people to Dundee. The city’s regeneration has so far been fantastic however we must all work together to ensure it works for every part of Dundee, from the smallest bairn to the biggest company.”<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Paul Jennings of VisitDundee said:<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >\"VisitDundee has been created to help capture the incredible opportunity facing the city, we want to maximise the economic impact of our tourism assets for the benefit of the wider community. We hope to work across the private and public sector as promoting Dundee as a great place to visit and stay needs to be an inclusive effort.\"<\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">ENDS<\/span><\/hatul><hatul ><span style=\"font-weight:bold;\">Notes to editors<\/span><\/hatul><hatul >Media enquiries contact&nbsp;jack@dundeesnp.org&nbsp;01382 week I joined my SNP colleague&nbsp;Chris Law MP&nbsp;in visiting the PDSA hospital in Dundee.<\/hatul><hatul>The PDSA recently announced their introduction of a reduced cost service for those who are in receipt of numerous benefits, in addition to their existing free service for those on Housing Benefit, Universal Credit with Housing element or Council Tax Support.<\/hatul><hatul>Those who can benefit from the reduced cost service include those on Child Tax or Working Tax Credits, Universal Credit without&nbsp;housing elements, Pension Credit, Job Seeker’s Allowance, Income Support, ESA, Disability Living Allowance, Personal Independence Payments, or a combination of any number of these benefits. State-retired pensioners who are householders in Council Tax Bands A-D are also eligible for the reduced cost service.<\/hatul><hatul>I was thoroughly impressed, not just by the facilities but by the dedication and commitment of the staff there. It is quite obvious that the vets and nurses care deeply about the animals and their owners, I’m happy to see this scheme being rolled out which will help pets and their owners across the city even more.<\/hatul><hatul>The PDSA is a fantastic charity and one that is well worth our support, I would encourage everyone to try and support them in what way they can.
